    • Method Detail

      • checkUpdateClient

        public void checkUpdateClient()
        Description copied from interface: ConsoleInteractive
        Some console implementations do support terminal auto detection, etc. Normally they perform these tasks on initial handshake in the beginning of the session. You can call this method in some special cases, when there is a need to try to re-handshake session parameters eventually, for example: shell calls this method when displaying prompt so when client reconnects to the console later with different terminal this change would be re-checked.
        Specified by:
        checkUpdateClient in interface ConsoleInteractive

        public boolean isInteractive()

        Returns:

      • sendProgress

        public void sendProgress(String string)
        Description copied from interface: ConsoleInteractive
        Optional. Sends an undefined progress. Implementation dependent. Could be ignored, could print dots, could update busy indicator etc. Must support defer-buffering, could be called frequently, needs to be updated pretty seldom.
        Specified by:
        sendProgress in interface ConsoleInteractive
